Package routing.abstractions

Interface IRouteGenerator

public interface IRouteGenerator
Helper for generating routes with customized properties.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default java.util.List<RouteNode> generateRouteForPedestrians​(IGeoPosition pointA, IGeoPosition pointB, java.lang.String startingOsmNodeRef, java.lang.String finishingOsmNodeRef)

    Generate the list of RouteNode elements tracing the route from point A to point B.
    java.util.List<RouteNode> generateRouteInfoForBuses​(java.util.List<OSMWay> route, java.util.List<StationNode> stationNodes)  

  • Method Details

    • generateRouteInfo

      java.util.List<RouteNode> generateRouteInfo​(IGeoPosition pointA, IGeoPosition pointB, java.lang.String startingOsmNodeRef, java.lang.String finishingOsmNodeRef, java.lang.String typeOfVehicle, boolean bewareOfJammedEdge)
      Generate the list of RouteNode elements tracing the route from point A to point B. The routing is OSM-Node-based, which means that the route consists of OSM Nodes, called non-virtual nodes. The route is also uniformed by default, which means that there are additional nodes, called virtual nodes, which are added for brevity so that the distances between each consecutive nodes are close to constant, so that later on it is easy to measure velocity of the vehicles passing the routes.
      Parameters:
      pointA - The geographical coordinates of the departure place.
      pointB - The geographical coordinates of the arrival place.
      startingOsmNodeRef - The OSM Node ID of the node which should be the first on the route. If null is passed, then the generator will automatically find the best match among OSM nodes found on this route.
      finishingOsmNodeRef - The OSM Node ID of the node which should be the last on the route. If null is passed, then the generator will automatically find the best match among OSM nodes found on this route.
      typeOfVehicle - The type of vehicle to be passed to the GraphHopper routing API, such as "foot", "car", "bike".
      bewareOfJammedEdge - Parameter which defines, whether the route should avoid the GraphHopper edges, which are at the time being added to the forbidden edge set.
      Returns:
      List of RouteNode elements containing the desired route.

    • generateRouteInfo

      default java.util.List<RouteNode> generateRouteInfo​(IGeoPosition pointA, IGeoPosition pointB, java.lang.String typeOfVehicle)
